text: Mudumbai Seshachalu Narasimhan (7 June 1932 - 16 May 2021) was an Indian mathematician. He was known, along with C. S. Seshadri, for their proof of the Narasimhanâ€“Seshadri theorem. He was elected as a member of the Fellows of the Royal Society. He was the only Indian to receive the King Faisal International Prize in the field of science. Narasimhan died on 16 May 2021, aged 88. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Indian mathematicians
title: M. S. Narasimhan
